item.title: PageSpeed Online
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: Unfortunately the Chrome PageSpeed plugin hasn’t worked for me in a long time. WebPagetest.org appears to no longer include PageSpeed analysis in reports either. That leaves PageSpeed Online has the only option for running a PageSpeed analysis on a site. I really liked using the Chrome plugin (back when I could still get it to […]
item.content:encoded:
Unfortunately the Chrome PageSpeed plugin hasn’t worked for me in a long time. WebPagetest.org appears to no longer include PageSpeed analysis in reports either.

That leaves PageSpeed Online has the only option for running a PageSpeed analysis on a site.

I really liked using the Chrome plugin (back when I could still get it to work), but I’m happy to see there is at least one place where you can still run a PageSpeed analysis.

item.title: ioprofile
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: ioprofile ( now called pt-ioprofile ) is a nifty tool for seeing the I/O activity of a process: The ioprofile tool captures a process’s I/O activity through lsof and strace and summarizes it. The result is a tabular display that shows you where the process spent its time on I/O operations. Here is a screenshot […]
item.content:encoded:
ioprofile ( now called pt-ioprofile ) is a nifty tool for seeing the I/O activity of a process:

The ioprofile tool captures a process’s I/O activity through lsof and strace and summarizes it. The result is a tabular display that shows you where the process spent its time on I/O operations.

Here is a screenshot from the first example in the original ioprofile docs:

Which shows the time spent in I/O for each of those files. Another useful option is the see the byte count of I/O for each file:

item.title: PhantomJS: Headless WebKit with JavaScript API

item.description: PhantomJS: Headless WebKit with JavaScript API. The rendering example looks promising for capturing screenshots of URLs.

item.title: Tim Bray on WordPress
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: There are lots of good products out there, but for self-hosted blogging in 2011, it’s really hard to beat WordPress. Tim Bray · Things about Blogging
item.content:encoded:
There are lots of good products out there, but for self-hosted blogging in 2011, it’s really hard to beat WordPress.

Tim Bray · Things about Blogging

item.title: IE6 Countdown
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: The IE6 Countdown – if Microsoft can’t convince people to stop using IE6, no one can.
item.content:encoded: The IE6 Countdown – if Microsoft can’t convince people to stop using IE6, no one can.

item.title: Consumer group wants to tax Netflix to pay for rural broadband
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: Consumer group wants to tax Netflix to pay for rural broadband – doesn’t make any sense to me. This would be like taxing people extra who use the most long distance minutes, even though they already pay to use those minutes.
item.content:encoded: Consumer group wants to tax Netflix to pay for rural broadband – doesn’t make any sense to me. This would be like taxing people extra who use the most long distance minutes, even though they already pay to use those minutes.

item.title: Android Reboot
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: Just a minute, I have to reboot my phone. – Brother-in-law trying to take a video from his Android phone I asked him more about this, he indicated that some of the apps he had downloaded had memory leaks (he wasn’t sure which ones) and needed to reboot the phone regularly. Recording video just locks […]
item.content:encoded:
Just a minute, I have to reboot my phone.

– Brother-in-law trying to take a video from his Android phone

I asked him more about this, he indicated that some of the apps he had downloaded had memory leaks (he wasn’t sure which ones) and needed to reboot the phone regularly. Recording video just locks up until doing a reboot.
